Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target.impl

Class BaseSyncAsset

java.lang.Object
io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target.impl.BaseSyncAsset
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISyncDataType
public abstract class BaseSyncAsset extends Object implements ISyncDataType
Base abstract class a sync target asset instance need to inherit from.

In order to make it easier for synchronization target implementation, all data for assets to make persistent are directly applied to an asset instance, representing the data structure of the target system. These instances need to implement the abstract functions of this base class to store the data. Then the Smint.io Integration Core Library is able to pass all related data to it.

Since some more transient data is needed, there are some base functions implemented by this base class, to handle these transient data. Derived classes do not need to take care of this transient data and thus do not need to override these functions. In order to avoid unintended overriding, these functions are marked as final.

Instances derived from this base class are created utilizing a factory function like ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncBinaryAsset() or ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncCompoundAsset(). Although this single base class handles Binary Assets and Compound Assets simultaneously, there might be requirements to use different implementations on the sync target. It is totally up to the sync target. Since synchronizing is performed one-way, at the moment, these instances are never used to read data. So only the abstract setters must be implemented.

Two types of assets

On Smint.io an asset is a unique collection - with a unique ID setTransactionUuid(String) - of its meta data (eg: name, description, licenses, restrictions, etc.) and the attached binary data (eg: picture), where each binary data has its own additional Binary ID (see setBinaryUuid(String)).
With synchronization targets, the digital binary data is in the center of storing data, as this is what most DAM are using. So synchronization creates a direct mapping between a binary data on the target platform to the binary data on the Smint.io platform, although this is not straight forward as Smint.io uses a different notion of data as its base.

There are two type of assets in use with Smint.io. This base class is intended to handle both type of assets but the kind of asset is determined by isCompoundAsset().

  1. Binary Asset (BaseSyncAsset) - assets with a single binary attached.
  2. Compound Asset () - assets that contain multiple binaries e.g. a recipe containing a picture, some text and some calories information - three binaries in total.

An asset is a clone/copy of an original content, copied at the event of purchase (see setContentElementUuid(String)). Every purchase creates such a copy - even if the same content (eg: image, video, etc.) is bought again.

Storage of Binary Asset

Single Asset can be stored straight forward. Although it might seem unnecessary, it is strongly advised to store the Binary ID (see setBinaryUuid(String)) with each binary, too.

Storage of Compound Asset

Compound Asset is a container for a list of multiple binaries and maintains a strong connection between these. It is so strong, that these binaries are never to be split-up. Because of this strong connection, all binaries use the same asset ID (see setTransactionUuid(String)). Nevertheless each binary has its Binary ID (see setBinaryUuid(String)). The binaries that are part of this Compound Asset can be retrieved by calling getAssetParts(). In case the synchronization target support the same concept of a compound item, a single asset should be created on the target, too. Nevertheless each item in the list of asset parts may contain meta data additional to that of the asset.

Unfortunately the concept of Compound Asset seems not very commonly used with Digital Asset Management systems. Usually such system focus on a single digital, binary data, using it as the base for data storage. Therefore chances are high, that the synchronization target will not support compound assets. Fortunately most of these systems have some form of Virtual Asset, that can be used instead to simulate a Compound Asset. The Virtual Asset usually do not show up in the UI but can be used to store some data. In this case, to store the list of IDs of the binaries that are part of this Compound Asset (see getAssetParts()). For that case, all asset parts (a.k.a. binaries) contain a complete set of meta data, as they are stored as a separate entity with the synchronization target. As these binaries share the same asset ID, their unique identifier is the combination of the asset ID and the binary ID.

Mapping asset IDs between sync target and Smint.io

Each asset contains a unique ID on the synchronization target (setTargetAssetUuid(String)). Nevertheless the Smint.io platform ID (setTargetAssetUuid(String)) does not address a single binary, and thus each asset on the sync target must store a composite Smint.io key, consisting of Asset ID (setTransactionUuid(String)) and Binary ID (setBinaryUuid(String)). Only this composite key allows a proper mapping of synchronization target IDs and Smint.io binaries. However, Virtual Assets do not have any binary directly attached. So these have to be identified on the target by some target dependent type identifier. 

 targetAssetUuid == uuid + binaryUuid
 targetVirtualAssetUuid == uuid + targetTypeIdentifier

Localized texts with translations

The texts with translations, the possibly available translations are defined by the value of ISettingsModel.getImportLanguages(). However, not all languages might have a valid translation. Languages without a translation might be omitted. Especially if this is a persistent asset and a new language has been added to the list of languages after storing the asset to the synchronization target, some existing translations might be missing. Such cases are not detected by the synchronization job and unchanged assets will not be updated. Only changes on the Smint.io platform are detected. All changes on the synchronization target are discarded.

Displaying localized texts

All texts of this asset are localized (see setName(Map). However, not all texts are available in all languages. To display such a text need to take this into consideration. In case a text is not available in the target language, a default language should be used and if the text is not available with it, the first language in the list should be used instead.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseSyncAsset

      public BaseSyncAsset()

  • Method Details

    • setTargetAssetUuid

      public final BaseSyncAsset setTargetAssetUuid(String targetAssetUuid)
      Sets a synchronization target's ID for this asset.

      Only assets that have already made persistent to the synchronization target have a Target Asset UUID. This value is set by ISyncJob as it asks ISyncTarget.getTargetAssetBinaryUuid(String, String) for the target asset ID for each asset, based on the Smint.io License Purchase Transaction UUID (setTransactionUuid(String)), which is the effective Smint.io platform UUID for an asset. Assets that have never been made persistent with the sync target will not receive an sync target asset UUid.

      Parameters:
      targetAssetUuid - the sync target's ID for this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • getTargetAssetUuid

      public final String getTargetAssetUuid()
      provides the a synchronization target's ID for this asset as set with setTargetAssetUuid(String).
      Returns:
      the target asset uuid or null.

    • setRecommendedFileName

      public BaseSyncAsset setRecommendedFileName(String fileName)
      Set the recommended file name to use on the file system storage.
      Parameters:
      fileName - a valid file name or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • getRecommendedFileName

      public final String getRecommendedFileName()
      Provides the recommended file name to use on the file system storage.
      Returns:
      a valid file name or null.

    • setDownloadedFileProvider

      public BaseSyncAsset setDownloadedFileProvider(Provider<File> downloadFileProvider)
      Sets a provider for the binary file of this Simple Asset that will download the binary data.

      The provider is utilized in getDownloadedFile() to download the binary data to a temporary file.

      Parameters:
      downloadFileProvider - a provider that will download the binary data from the Smint.io API and store it into a temporary file. This temporary file will then be returned.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • getDownloadedFile

      public final File getDownloadedFile() throws FileNotFoundException, SmintIoAuthenticatorException
      Downloads and provides the binary file of this Simple Asset.

      Downloading the file happens only once, at the first call to this function. For the actual download, the provider set by setDownloadedFileProvider(Provider) is used. Further calls will return the same downloaded file and bypass the provider - even if the file has been deleted meanwhile.

      Returns:
      a valid file or null if no download provider has been set yet.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file system failed to store the download, thus it can not be found after the download has started. This is also thrown if the download URL is wrong and the file can not be found on the Smint.io platform.
      SmintIoAuthenticatorException - if authentication to the Smint.io API has failed.

    • setAssetParts

      public final BaseSyncAsset setAssetParts(BaseSyncAsset[] compoundParts)
      Sets a list of parts for this compound asset - only applicable if this is a compound asset.

      Calling this function marks this asset as a compound asset - no matter whether asset parts are being set or not.

      Parameters:
      compoundParts - the parts that form the compound asset. If null or an empty list, this asset is not regarded as a Compound Asset anymore.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • getAssetParts()

    • getAssetParts

      public final BaseSyncAsset[] getAssetParts()
      provides the list of parts for this compound asset - only applicable if this is a compound asset.
      Returns:
      the parts that form the compound asset. If null or an empty list, this asset is not regarded as a Compound Asset anymore.

    • setTransactionUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setTransactionUuid(String smintIoId)
      Sets the License Purchase Transaction UUID, the effective Smint.io platform ID, for the asset.

      On Smint.io platform each purchased asset is related to the actual purchase context, which is called "license purchase transaction". Only this transaction contains the complete license context. Different license requirements may impose different costs. So the license heavily depends on the purchase context.

      Parameters:
      smintIoId - the Smint.io platform ID to set for the asset.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setName

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setName(Map<Locale,String> name)
      Sets a name for the asset, translated to multiple languages.

      The possible translations available are defined by the value of ISettingsModel.getImportLanguages(). However, not all languages might have a valid translation. Languages without a translation might be omitted from the map. Especially if this is a persistent asset and a new language has been added to the list of languages. Then the new language might have not yet been stored to this persistent asset.

      Parameters:
      name - the multi-language name of the asset.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • isCompoundAsset

      public boolean isCompoundAsset()
      Determines whether this asset is a Compound Asset or an Binary Asset.

      The implementation of this function will check for the existence of asset parts, retrieved with getAssetParts(). If a valid list with at least 1 asset part is available, then this is a Compound Asset

      Returns:
      true if setAssetParts(BaseSyncAsset[]) has already been called.
      See Also:
      • Two types of assets

    • setContentElementUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setContentElementUuid(String contentElementUuid)
      Sets the UUID of the content element this asset is a copy of.

      Assets are copies of content elements. As a source of the asset, content elements form the link to the upstream content provider. Although much its data is copied to the asset, it still is a necessary link to the original source. The asset is copied from the original source by a purchase transaction on the Smint.io platform.

      Parameters:
      contentElementUuid - the Smint.io ID of the original source this asset is a copy of or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setContentType

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setContentType(String contentTypeKey)
      Sets the content type of this binary of the related asset.

      The value is a sync target platform specific ID, mapped from Smint.io key.

      Parameters:
      contentTypeKey - the sync target ID or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • ISmintIoAsset.getContentType()

    • setSmintIoUrl

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setSmintIoUrl(URL smintIoUrl)
      Sets the Web URL to view the asset on the Smint.io platform in the browser.

      The URL to the web view of the asset on the Smint.io platform can be used by users, to view more information about the asset on the Smint.io platform. Especially what part of collection it is, further discussions, ratings and feedbacks on this asset. The Smint.io platform provides more data than can possibly be stored with a synchronization target.
      Example: 

           https://demo.smint.io/project/21/content-element/7:0:256245306

      A user to access this URL still need permissions on the Smint.io platform to do so. Usually a separate user for the platform is needed.

      Parameters:
      smintIoUrl - the URL to the web page on the Smint.io platform for this asset.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setCreatedAt

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setCreatedAt(OffsetDateTime createdAt)
      Sets the date, when this asset has been created.
      Parameters:
      createdAt - the date of creation of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLastUpdatedAt

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLastUpdatedAt(OffsetDateTime lastUpdatedAt)
      Sets the date, when this asset has been updated the last time.

      The last update time is not used to compare for updated content. Times seem to be too prune to different settings on servers of Smint.io and sync target. Hence all meta data of assets are updated, once Smint.io detects a change. Binary data uses a simple, increasing counter as version number (see setBinaryVersion(int)) which can be used to see, which binary is the newest one. Only Smint.io platform will update the binary data, though. Without a single source, increasing counter would not work as they are not unique then.

      Parameters:
      lastUpdatedAt - the date of last update of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setPurchasedAt

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setPurchasedAt(OffsetDateTime purchasedAt)
      Sets the date, when this asset has been purchased.
      Parameters:
      purchasedAt - the date of purchase of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setCartPurchaseTransactionUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setCartPurchaseTransactionUuid(String cartPurchaseTransactionUuid)
      Sets the unique Smint.io platform ID of the purchase cart this asset was part of.

      Every purchase consists of a single cart, that collects all assets to pay for in a single transaction. At least there is 1 asset in a cart but the amount is unrestricted. An asset can only be part of a single cart but the cart may contain multiple assets.

      Parameters:
      cartPurchaseTransactionUuid - the ID of the purchase or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setHasBeenCancelled

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setHasBeenCancelled(boolean hasBeenCancelled)
      Set to true if the purchase transaction has been cancelled prior to fulfillment of payment.

      Assets are regarded as being purchased until this value is being set to true. If set to true, then the user was strongly interested in the asset but actually did not buy it. Thus no license is available to really use this asset.

      Such a situation might happen in case the asset has been already purchased in the past and therefore is managed by the sync target. Nevertheless the maximum number of usage/downloads have been reached and more must be purchased. If the purchase is being cancelled for some reason, it will be indicated by this flag.

      Parameters:
      hasBeenCancelled - if true the purchase transaction for new licenses has been cancelled.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setProjectUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setProjectUuid(String projectUuid)
      Sets the Smint.io ID of the project this asset has been purchased for.

      On Smint.io platform every purchase is related to a project context. It provides more insights about further purchase, other collections and more. So the project ID is necessary to retrieve this context in the future. Eg. the web view of the asset is composed making use of the project ID (see setSmintIoUrl(URL)).

      Parameters:
      projectUuid - the Smint.io ID of the project context for this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • setProjectName(Map)

    • setProjectName

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setProjectName(Map<Locale,String> projectName)
      Sets the Smint.io localized name of the project this asset has been purchased for.

      On Smint.io platform every purchase is related to a project context. It provides more insights about further purchase, other collections and more. So the project ID is necessary to retrieve this context in the future. Eg. the web view of the asset is composed making use of the project ID (see setSmintIoUrl(URL)).

      Parameters:
      projectName - the Smint.io name of the project context for this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • setProjectUuid(String)

    • setCollectionUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setCollectionUuid(String collectionUuid)
      Sets the Smint.io ID of the collection this asset is part of.

      On Smint.io platform every asset may be added to a collection within the project context. The collections can be used to prepare purchase or collect assets for certain tasks before selecting the ones to really buy.

      If possible, the name of the project should be visible on the UI to provide a fast feedback to the user for which project this asset has been acquired.

      Parameters:
      collectionUuid - the Smint.io collection's ID this asset is part of or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • setCollectionName(Map)

    • setCollectionName

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setCollectionName(Map<Locale,String> collectionName)
      Sets the Smint.io localized name of the collection this asset is part of.

      On Smint.io platform every asset may be added to a collection within the project context. The collections can be used to prepare purchase or collect assets for certain tasks before selecting the ones to really buy.

      If possible, the name of the collection should be visible on the UI to provide a fast feedback to the user how this asset has been acquired and its purchase has been prepared.

      Parameters:
      collectionName - the Smint.io collection's name this asset is part of or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • setCollectionUuid(String)

    • setKeywords

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setKeywords(Map<Locale,String[]> keywords)
      Sets a list of localized keywords to be used for keyword searches.

      The list of keywords are usually provided by the upstream content provider (see setContentProvider(String)). These keywords can be used for keyword searches. However, not all keywords are available for every language.

      Parameters:
      keywords - the localized list of keywords or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setCopyrightNotices

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setCopyrightNotices(Map<Locale,String> copyrightNotices)
      Sets a localized list of copyright notices to indicate the copyright owner of this asset.

      The copyright notice usually is provided by the upstream content provider (see setContentProvider(String)). Not all languages may contain proper copyright notice. If the language to display does not have a notice available, use the one for English or the first one available.

      Parameters:
      copyrightNotices - the localized copyright notices or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setIsEditorialUse

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setIsEditorialUse(Boolean isEditorialUse)
      Sets a flag that this asset can only be used for editorial use.

      Until a value has been passed to this function, it can not be determined whether the asset is for editorial use only or not. There might be some content provider that do not provide this information on some assets. It simply is impossible to tell. The default assumption and its derived legal action depends on the synchronization target. Smint.io can not give any advise how to handle such content.

      Parameters:
      isEditorialUse - Boolean.TRUE in case the asset is allowed for Editorial Use only and Boolean.FALSE if the asset can be used for Creative content, too. If this can not be determined, than null is being set.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setHasRestrictiveLicenseTerms

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setHasRestrictiveLicenseTerms(boolean hasLicenseRestrictiveTerms)
      Sets a flag whether this asset has additional restrictive license terms attached or not.

      With many sync targets the license information is being stored in an unstructured way, that its data can not be easily analyzed. Then it is hard to tell, whether license terms are applied to this asset or not. Smint.io stores all license terms in a structured way and is able to detect such terms. Hence this flag is being set by Smint.io to indicate that additional structured license terms are attached to this asset.

      Until a value has been passed to this function, assume false as default.

      Parameters:
      hasLicenseRestrictiveTerms - true in case any license term/restriction applies to this asset.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseType

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseType(String licenseTypeKey)
      Sets a general type ID of the kind license applying to this asset.

      The type ID is a simple reading text, which has been defined up-front by Smint.io. Its value is arbitrary and uses mixed cases. Non-exhaustive example:

      • all - all is allowed, no restrictions are applied.
      • royalty_free - royalty free content.
      • rights_managed - rights managed content with more detailed license restrictions.
      • rights_ready

      Although a known set of values are used, some might be changed and more be added in the near future without any further notice. So implementing classes must support an arbitrary value.

      Parameters:
      licenseTypeKey - the key of the type of license or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseeUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseeUuid(String licenseeUuid)
      Sets a Smint.io ID for the licensee.

      Further information about the licensee can be retrieved from the Smint.io platform using this ID.

      Parameters:
      licenseeUuid - the Smint.io ID of the licensee or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseeName

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseeName(String licenseeName)
      Sets the name of the licensee.

      Further information about the licensee may be stored with the Smint.io platform, but at least this name can be used to display the licensee in the UI of the sync target. Usually this is the business name of the licensee.

      Parameters:
      licenseeName - the name of the licensee or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseText

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseText(Map<Locale,String> licenseText)
      Sets a localized text of the license that applies to this asset.

      The localized text contain a textual summary of the license and maybe additional information. This text is intended to be displayed in the UI along the asset.

      Parameters:
      licenseText - the localized text of the license or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseUrls

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseUrls(Map<Locale,String[]> licenseUrls)
      Sets localized links to further information regarding the license (e.g. provider license term pages, links to documents, etc.).

      Sets localized links to further information regarding the license (e.g. provider license term pages, links to documents, etc.). This text is intended to be displayed in the UI along the asset.

      Parameters:
      licenseUrls - the localized URLs of the license or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setLicenseTerms

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setLicenseTerms(ISyncLicenseTerm[] licenseTerms)
      Sets a list of license terms to apply to this asset.

      Every instance part of the list has been created with ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncLicenseTerm().

      Parameters:
      licenseTerms - the list of license terms of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setDownloadConstraints

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setDownloadConstraints(ISyncDownloadConstraints downloadConstraints)
      Sets download constraints to apply to this asset.

      The provided instance has been created with ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncDownloadConstraints().

      Parameters:
      downloadConstraints - the download constraints of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setReleaseDetails

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setReleaseDetails(ISyncReleaseDetails releaseDetails)
      Sets some release details of this asset, regarding agreements with visible models or property owners.

      Every provided instance has been created with ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncDownloadConstraints().

      Parameters:
      releaseDetails - release details of this asset or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setBinaryUuid

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setBinaryUuid(String binaryUuid)
      Set the Smint.io UUID to the single binary for the asset.
      Parameters:
      binaryUuid - the Smint.io platform UUID for the binary file of this asset.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setBinaryType

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setBinaryType(String binaryTypeKey)
      Sets the type of the binary as a key.

      The value is a sync target platform specific ID, mapped from Smint.io key.

      Parameters:
      binaryTypeKey - the sync target ID of exclusivity granted or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setBinaryLocale

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setBinaryLocale(Locale binaryLocale)
      Sets the locale (language) this binary contains.

      Binary data may contain language specific symbols or other data, or be a translated variant of another binary data. In these cases, the language this asset is closely related and best suited for, can be set. Its value can be used for filtered searches.

      Parameters:
      binaryLocale - the locale to set or null if none is applicable.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setBinaryVersion

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setBinaryVersion(int binaryVersion)
      Set the binary version to a new value.

      The binary version is used to detect changes on the binary file. Every change will increase the version number. So the newest version will be the one with the highest version number. Nevertheless this one-way synchronization will not sync back any changes to the Smint.io platform.

      Parameters:
      binaryVersion - the new binary version as a positive number, which must be greater or equal to 0.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case the parameter is set to a negative value.
      See Also:
      • Two types of assets

    • setBinaryUsage

      public abstract BaseSyncAsset setBinaryUsage(Map<Locale,String> binaryUsage)
      Sets a localized textual description of the usage definition for the binary.
      Parameters:
      binaryUsage - a localized description of the usage definitions for the binary or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
      See Also:
      • Two types of assets
